#summary One-sentence summary of this page.

= Introduction =

Here is a collection of standards and specifications for represenatation of GIS data in the XML spectrum.


= Details =

[http://microformats.org/wiki/geo microformats] 
may be a common source of RDF data.  They reference RFC2426.


[http://www.georss.org/xml/1.1/georss.xsd GeoRSS] is probably the most widely deployed standard for expressing gis data.  It is supported on MS live.  (Google oddly, created their own, KML)


[http://www.w3.org/2005/Incubator/geo/XGR-geo-20071023/ The GeoSpacial working group]  has proposed an [http://www.w3.org/2005/Incubator/geo/XGR-geo-20071023/W3C_XGR_Geo_files/geo_2007.owl OWL specification] based on top of GeoRss.
